jobs.title: Mechanical Engineer
jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Focused Energy

At Focused Energy, we are pioneering laser-driven nuclear fusion, and unlocking powerful new technologies along the way. One of these is our Laser-Driven Radiation Source (LDRS): a compact, high-precision neutron system based on advanced laser–plasma physics. Designed to transform non-destructive testing, LDRS has far-reaching applications across energy, security, and infrastructure. From enabling safe long-term storage of nuclear waste to enhancing border protection and supporting the energy transition, this spin-off technology not only accelerates our path to fusion power but also tackles some of the most urgent technical and societal challenges of our time. Become a part of bringing advanced laser-driven radiation technologies to market readiness! As our Mechanical Engineer you will be a core member of our product development team, driving the design, integration, and prototyping of critical hardware systems. You will collaborate closely across disciplines to deliver robust, scalable mechanical solutions that meet technical, regulatory, and operational demands.

What you’ll do

  • Design, develop, and refine mechanical components and assemblies with a strong focus on manufacturability, robustness, and scalability.

  • Lead mechanical prototyping efforts, coordinating fabrication, assembly, and testing with internal teams and external partners.

  • Develop innovative mechanical solutions for mechano-optical modules, optimizing functionality while managing costs.

  • Conduct tolerance analysis, structural and thermal simulations (FEA), and material assessments for radiation and vacuum environments.

  • Ensure all designs comply with industry standards, safety regulations, radiation shielding protocols, and cleanroom requirements.

  • Produce detailed product documentation for manufacturing, procurement, testing, and maintenance.

  • Lead and actively participate in technical design reviews, incorporating multidisciplinary feedback to improve designs continuously.

Who you are

  • 5+ years of proven experience in mechanical design and development, with a strong emphasis on Design for Manufacture (DFM).

  • Solid expertise with CAD software, preferably Autodesk Inventor, and proficiency in tolerance analysis and FEM simulation.

  • In-depth knowledge of manufacturing processes, materials, and production techniques, ideally with experience in vacuum systems, cleanroom operations, or mechano-optical systems.

  • Experience or familiarity with safety and regulatory requirements for radiation environments and relevant shielding protocols.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills combined with a sharp attention to detail and the ability to critically evaluate technical designs.

  • Proficiency in German and ability to travel to Darmstadt (Hessia, Germany) on a regular basis

Why join us?

  • The opportunity to shape the future of a fast-growing startup solving challenges with global relevance.

  • Strong personal growth potential with the chance to lead your own projects from early on.

  • A dynamic, collaborative team culture with flat hierarchies and short decision paths.

  • Daily exchange with top experts in fusion, simulation, and engineering to accelerate your learning.

  • Flexibility through hybrid work options and adaptable working hours.

  • A competitive salary package aligned with your experience and responsibilities.

What we offer:

  • Innovative Technology & Mission: Be part of a cutting-edge company working on groundbreaking research in clean energy and scientific discovery.

  • Career Development: We invest in our people. This is an opportunity to join an early, growing company at the forefront of new technology, where you’ll have the opportunity to develop and grow your career.

  • Collaborative Culture: Work with great people in a dynamic, international environment with top-tier scientists, engineers and professionals passionate about solving global challenges.

  • Ownership: Take ownership from day 1 and drive impact by making decisions, solving challenges and shaping the future of our company.

  • Your Success is our Success: We offer a competitive salary and company ownership in the form of stock options, giving you a direct stake in our success and ownership in what we build together.

  • Vacation Days: We support your work-life-balance by granting you 30 days of vacation per year.

  • Flexibility: We believe work should adapt to your life—not the other way around. That’s why we offer a hybrid setup, giving you the freedom to work from our office while also enjoying the flexibility to work from home when it suits you.

  • Snacks and Drinks: Our office fridges are never empty. Enjoy our healthy snacks and drinks. Our Darmstadt office even offers a subsidized canteen with delicious lunch options daily.

  • Retirement Plan: If you decide for a private pension plan, we will finance 15% on top of your monthly contributions.

  • Equipment: Choose between a state-of-the-art Windows or Apple Laptop. In addition, you will receive a keyboard, mouse and headset so you are fully equipped from day 1.

  • Events: We organize regular events to foster team bonding, encourage collaboration, and build a strong, supportive company culture. Connect with colleagues across departments, share ideas, and have fun together, both in and outside of the workplace.

  • Mobility with NAVIT: We partner with NAVIT to support your flexible commuting needs—whether it’s a public transportation ticket, taxi rides or car-sharing you choose what fits your lifestyle.

About Focused Energy

At Focused Energy, we are developing NeoLyte, a breakthrough initiative that pioneers compact, laser-driven radiation sources (LDRS) based on high-power laser technology. These dual-mode sources combine MeV X-rays and fast neutrons in a single system. The platform is modular and enables real-time, non-destructive inspection of materials, even when those that are complex or shielded. NeoLyte’s technology addresses critical challenges across nuclear waste analysis, contraband detection, infrastructure inspection, and medical isotope production. With its unique combination of resolution, material specificity, and deployment flexibility, LDRS open up new possibilities far beyond conventional systems. We bring together a cross-disciplinary team of laser and plasma physicists, engineers, and AI experts. We are building our first pilot facility in Biblis (Germany), with the goal to reach market readiness and commercial deployment quite soon. Be part of shaping this deep-tech venture from the ground up! As our Senior Optical Engineer, you will play a pivotal role in conceptualizing and realizing the optical systems that are critical to our product roadmap, leading projects and collaborating closely across disciplines to bring cutting-edge optical solutions from concept to production.

What you’ll do

  • Design and specify concept and detailed designs for complex optical systems, aligned with functional and performance requirements.

  • Lead the integration of optical components with mechanical, electrical, and software subsystems, ensuring seamless product functionality.

  • Drive development projects, providing technical leadership and mentoring junior engineers on optical design and problem-solving.

  • Develop and implement qualification and validation test plans to verify optical system performance and reliability.

  • Innovate and push the boundaries of optical technology by researching and developing novel optical concepts and solutions.

  • Manage collaborations with laser suppliers and external partners to ensure alignment with ambitious product milestones.

  • Participate actively in design reviews of relevant modules, ensuring manufacturability and adherence to regulatory and quality standards.

  • Proven ability to lead multidisciplinary projects and collaborate effectively with engineers from mechanical, electrical, and software disciplines.

  • Demonstrated technical leadership experience, guiding teams and influencing project direction.

  • Solid knowledge of precision mechanics and opto-mechanical design principles to support integration efforts.

  • Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills with a track record of developing and validating innovative solutions.

  • Proactive communicator with the ability to clearly present complex optical concepts to diverse stakeholders.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
Focused Energy is a fusion energy startup with the goal of generating unlimited clean energy to responsibly meet future global demand. The founders include two highly renowned scientists and a long-time entrepreneur and founder of several successful startups. With the use and commercialization of laser-induced inertial fusion, a clean and highly efficient power generation technology is coming within reach, suitable to ensure a secure and scalable future energy supply.

We are seeking a highly skilled and motivated Laser Engineer to lead the development of novel laser amplifier modules for Inertial Fusion Energy (IFE) applications. This position is ideal for a mid to senior-level professional with deep expertise in high-energy laser systems, including both diode-pumped and flashlamp-pumped technologies. The successful candidate will play a key role in designing, developing, and testing cutting-edge amplifier modules, with a strong emphasis on leading experimental work in the lab.

What you’ll do:

  • Lead and execute R&D projects focused on diode-pumped and flashlamp-pumped laser amplifier module development for IFE.

  • Conduct thorough research and develop innovative concepts for high-energy and/or high-average power laser systems and/or sub-systems.

  • Design and analyze laser systems and sub-systems, ensuring they meet the highest standards of performance and reliability. Program, model, and calculate laser system performance, efficiency, and cost. Define specifications of equipment or optical components.

  • Define test plans and lead experimental work in the laboratory, including laser construction, alignment, diagnostics, and performance characterization.

  • Collaborate with multidisciplinary teams (optics, thermal, mechanical, systems engineering) to the design optical layouts, thermal management systems, and mechanical assemblies for high-energy laser amplifiers and integrate amplifier modules into larger laser architectures.

  • Drive iterative design improvements based on experimental results and system performance metrics.

  • Provide mentorship to junior engineers and technicians working in the lab.

  • Maintain detailed documentation of designs, experimental procedures, results, and system configurations.

  • Present technical updates to internal stakeholders and contribute to external publications and conferences as appropriate.

Who you are:

  • Master's or PhD degree in optics or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education and experience, with advanced knowledge of complex physics, optics, or laser systems.

  • 5-10+ years of experience in developing, modeling, designing, analyzing, constructing, and characterizing laser systems, preferably in high-energy pulsed lasers or IFE-related applications.

  • Demonstrated hands-on experience with diode-pumped and/or flashlamp-pumped laser systems.

  • Strong laboratory leadership skills, with the ability to manage complex experiments and coordinate team efforts.

  • Expertise in laser safety, alignment, and diagnostics tools (e.g., beam profiling, power/energy meters, spectrometers).

  • Proficient with optical design software (e.g., Zemax, LASCAD, or similar) and CAD tools.

  • Excellent problem-solving skills, attention to detail, and the ability to work independently and in collaborative environments. 

  • Advanced written and verbal communication skills in English are necessary to deliver presentations, prepare written reports, explain technical information, and provide advice to project sponsors and external collaborators.\

  • Preferred: Experience with high-repetition-rate laser systems or large-scale laser facilities (e.g., NIF, Laser Megajoule, or similar).

  • Preferred: Familiarity with IFE concepts and system-level laser integration challenges.

  • Preferred: Track record of innovation, patents, or publications in relevant areas.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Focused Energy

Focused Energy is a fusion energy startup with the goal of commercializing laser-based inertial confinement fusion energy to help meet the world’s need for a clean, safe, and abundant energy supply. Focused Energy is currently seeking to fill multiple Senior Mechanical Engineer roles within the organization.

We are seeking a Senior Mechanical Engineer to join our dynamic laser development team. In this pivotal role, you will spearhead the research, conceptualization, design, analysis, construction, and characterization of advanced high-energy laser systems and their sub-systems.

What You Will Build

As part of our laser development team, you will design and integrate the mechanical backbone of high-energy laser systems. Your work will directly shape the success of our experiments and future fusion facilities. Specifically, you will:

  • Create precision opto-mechanical assemblies such as mounts, stages, and housings for large optics.

  • Engineer vacuum and high-voltage modules including chambers, flanges, and cooling interfaces.

  • Develop thermal management systems (water/air cooling, heat exchangers, fluidic circuits).

  • Build motion and alignment mechanisms capable of nano- to micrometer-precision positioning.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
At Focused Energy, we are pioneering laser-driven nuclear fusion, and unlocking powerful new technologies along the way. One of these is our Laser-Driven Radiation Source (LDRS): a compact, high-precision neutron system based on advanced laser–plasma physics. Designed to transform non-destructive testing, LDRS has far-reaching applications across energy, security, and infrastructure. From enabling safe long-term storage of nuclear waste to enhancing border protection and supporting the energy transition, this spin-off technology not only accelerates our path to fusion power but also tackles some of the most urgent technical and societal challenges of our time.

Become a part of bringing advanced laser-driven radiation technologies to market readiness! As our Machine Layout Engineer you will be a core member of our product development team, maintaining volume overview of individual components, detailing out installation sequences ensuring the overall mechanical integration of the systems. You will collaborate closely across disciplines and project teams to deliver robust, scalable solutions that meet technical, regulatory, and operational demands.

What you’ll do

  • Lead the team in developing an installation sequence for the volumetric integration of system modules.

  • Maintain an overview of the volumetric requirements of all system modules, validating the feasibility of installation, service, and operational aspects related to the layout.

  • Identify critical volume conflicts within the system and escalate them to development teams for resolution.

  • Conduct tolerance analysis to ensure precise positioning of components for accurate system assembly.

  • Collaborate closely with customers and research partners to determine facility requirements for future products and translate them into project specifications.

  • Assume ownership of all volume-related aspects of product development, detailing space requirements for modules, systems, tools, and operational demands.

  • Lead and actively participate in technical design reviews, integrating multidisciplinary feedback for continuous design improvement.

What you’ll bring

  • 5+ years of proven experience in mechanical design and development, with a strong emphasis on Design for Manufacture (DFM).

  • Solid expertise with CAD software, preferably Autodesk Inventor, and proficiency in tolerance analysis and FEM simulation.

  • Familiarity with safety and regulatory requirements for radiation environments and relevant shielding protocols.

  • Experience in system integration or assembly of large engineering systems would be a bonus

  • Excellent problem-solving skills combined with a sharp attention to detail and the ability to critically evaluate technical designs.

jobs.descriptionHtml:
About Focused Energy

Focused Energy is an international deep-tech company based in Germany and the US, working on the commercialization of laser-driven nuclear fusion. Our mission: provide clean, safe, and virtually unlimited energy to the world. We are scaling quickly and need experienced people who thrive in building clarity and structure in fast-growing environments.

This role plays a key role in building Focused Energy’s in-house accounting capabilities and ensuring financial accuracy as we expand globally.
This position combines hands-on ownership of the German entity’s accounting (GmbH) with global responsibility for the Accounts Payable (AP) process, supporting our shift from external providers to an internal accounting structure.

The role is based in Darmstadt/Frankfurt area (preferred), with the option to work from Berlin and travel monthly to Darmstadt. Fluency in both German and English is required.

What You’ll Do

At Focused Energy, you won’t just manage numbers — you’ll help build the financial backbone of a company working to unlock a new era of clean, limitless energy.
As our Senior Accountant, you will connect global entities, strengthen internal controls, and turn complexity into clarity.

In this role, you will:

  • Own the German GmbH books — manage monthly, quarterly, and annual closings under HGB, with working knowledge of IFRS for group reporting.

  • Lead the global Accounts Payable (AP) function: vendor onboarding, 3-way match, invoice validation, approvals, payment accuracy, and end-to-end documentation.

  • Reduce reliance on external accounting firms (Torque in Germany, Escalon in the US) by bringing key processes in-house.

  • Partner with auditors and tax advisors (including Big Four) to ensure audit readiness, compliance, and timely submissions.

  • Design and implement standardized global AP procedures, improving efficiency and transparency across all Focused Energy entities.

  • Collaborate with U.S. and German Finance teams on intercompany transactions, reconciliations, and consolidation efforts.

  • Support the upcoming ERP migration to NetSuite (go-live planned for Jan 2026) — mapping workflows, migrating data, and testing new integrations.

  • Build clear, scalable process documentation and internal controls that enable growth and ensure consistency across the company.

  • Provide financial visibility by preparing reports, reconciliations, and insights for management and auditors.

This is a hands-on, high-impact position where your expertise will shape not only our books — but how Focused Energy grows, scales, and earns the trust of a global community.

Who You Are

Must-Haves

  • Degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business Administration, or a certified accountant qualification.

  • 7+ years of professional accounting experience, ideally including in-house roles in international environments (startup, scale-up, or industry).

  • Strong technical expertise in HGB and working knowledge of IFRS.

  • Proven track record in monthly/annual closing, audit preparation, and Accounts Payable management.

  • Hands-on experience with ERP systems such as SAP, NetSuite, or Oracle.

  • Demonstrated ability to design, document, and improve accounting workflows with attention to accuracy and control.

  • Fluency in both German and English (required for daily collaboration).

  • A hands-on, detail-oriented, and proactive working style, with comfort operating in fast-growing, evolving environments.

Nice-to-Haves

  • Experience in a startup or small-to-medium-sized company where you built processes from scratch.

  • Prior exposure to group reporting, consolidation, or intercompany transactions.

  • Background in both public accounting (Big Four) and industry roles.

  • Familiarity with audit readiness and VAT topics in Germany.

  • Participation in an ERP implementation project (especially NetSuite).

  • Ability to work across time zones and collaborate effectively with U.S. finance counterparts.

What We Offer

  • A chance to join a groundbreaking company shaping the future of clean energy.

  • High responsibility and ownership in a core finance role.

  • Opportunity to build and professionalize processes in a scaling environment.

  • A diverse, international and highly motivated team.

  • Flexible work arrangements (hybrid).

  • Innovative Technology & Mission: Be part of a cutting-edge company working on groundbreaking research in clean energy and scientific discovery.

  • Career Development: We invest in our people. This is an opportunity to join an early, growing company at the forefront of new technology, where you’ll have the opportunity to develop and grow your career.

  • Collaborative Culture: Work with great people in a dynamic, international environment with top-tier scientists, engineers and professionals passionate about solving global challenges.

  • Ownership: Take ownership from day 1 and drive impact by making decisions, solving challenges and shaping the future of our company.

  • Your Success is our Success: We offer a competitive salary and company ownership in the form of stock options, giving you a direct stake in our success and ownership in what we build together.

  • Vacation Days: We support your work-life-balance by granting you 30 days of vacation per year.

  • Flexibility: We believe work should adapt to your life—not the other way around. That’s why we offer a hybrid setup, giving you the freedom to work from our office while also enjoying the flexibility to work from home when it suits you.

  • Snacks and Drinks: Our office fridges are never empty. Enjoy our healthy snacks and drinks. Our Darmstadt office even offers a subsidized canteen with delicious lunch options daily.

  • Retirement Plan: If you decide for a private pension plan, we will finance 15% on top of your monthly contributions.

  • Equipment: Choose between a state-of-the-art Windows or Apple Laptop. In addition, you will receive a keyboard, mouse and headset so you are fully equipped from day 1.

  • Events: We organize regular events to foster team bonding, encourage collaboration, and build a strong, supportive company culture. Connect with colleagues across departments, share ideas, and have fun together, both in and outside of the workplace.

  • Mobility with NAVIT: We partner with NAVIT to support your flexible commuting needs—whether it’s a public transportation ticket, taxi rides or car-sharing you choose what fits your lifestyle.

  • Fitness with Wellhub: We care about your health. Get access to a wide range of gyms, fitness studios and wellness services across Europe through our partnership with Wellhub.

Focused Energy is a fusion energy startup with the goal of generating unlimited clean energy to responsibly meet future global demand. With the use and commercialization of laser-induced inertial fusion, a clean and highly efficient power generation technology is coming within reach, suitable to ensure a secure and scalable future energy supply.

We are seeking a skilled and driven Experimental Scientist to perform experiments of laser beam smoothing and of laser-plasma instabilities to join our team and help us shape the future of energy. This person will have experience in performing state-of-the-art laser-plasma interaction experiments with high-energy laser beams and in the development of plasma diagnostics. Experience in building laser beamlines would be considered an asset.

In this role, you will be part of the Science team at Focused Energy, which is responsible for achieving designs for first-of-a-kind (FOAK) laser-based fusion power plant and for the precursor fusion pilot plan (FPP). Important parts of the work in the Science team are de-risking laser-plasma and hydrodynamic instabilities. The development of novel laser beam-smoothing techniques and their applications to spectrally broad bandwidth lasers are central to this de-risking work.

What you’ll do:

  • Perform optical laser beam smoothing experiments at the Focused Energy Laboratory Darmstadt.

  • Develop optical diagnostics to measure time-integrated and time-resolved laser-speckle far field pattern distribution.

  • Support simulation work, e.g., by running codes for beam smoothing and by comparing the measurements to simulation predictions.

  • Contribute to the development of plasma diagnostics for Focused Energy’s Experimental Facilities.

  • Support ongoing laser-plasma instability experiments at the GSI Phelix laser and the ELI L4 laser facility.

  • Identify the best smoothing techniques for our next generation laser beams.

Who you are:

  • You have a PhD degree in physics or in a science area related to laser-plasma interaction experiments.

  • Extensive experimental skills for setting up laser-plasma interaction experiments and optical alignment of laser beams.

  • Extensive data analysis experience from those experiments.
